intro: Scilla non-scripta subsp. cernua, commonly known as the nodding scilla, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its bluish-violet, bell-shaped flowers that hang downward, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in woodland and grassland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, rounded berries that contain the seeds. This subspecies is often found in the eastern United States, particularly in the Appalachian region.
